legacy.full_text:
买了一台二手的MacBook Pro 14英寸，M3 Max+36G内存+1T硬盘，1万5千块。原机主保护的很好，全身贴膜+屏幕防偷窥磁吸膜，电池99%。
我对Mac OS和Windows倒没什么偏好，过去几年用Windows居多，这次买Mac是想搞点东西。… https://t.co/f5OtAZUJfz

result.text:
买了一台二手的MacBook Pro 14英寸，M3 Max+36G内存+1T硬盘，1万5千块。原机主保护的很好，全身贴膜+屏幕防偷窥磁吸膜，电池99%。
我对Mac OS和Windows倒没什么偏好，过去几年用Windows居多，这次买Mac是想搞点东西。
最喜欢的Mac功能是三指拖动窗口，只用触控板完全没问题。Windows可以免费用的Win+V剪切板，Mac上必须得开个付费应用才能有类似的效果。然后发现Mac上原来有最小化全部窗口的快捷键，快捷键是逆天的：command+option+H+M（关闭其他+关闭当前）

result.text:
🆕 post: Why MCP Won

lessons from @dsp_, @alexalbert__, @sebmarkbage, @paulgauthier, and many more

https://t.co/UT256xqWMs

1. MCP is “AI-Native” version of old idea
2. MCP is an “open standard” with a big backer
3. Anthropic has the best developer AI brand
4. MCP based off LSP, an existing successful protocol
5. MCP dogfooded with complete set of 1st party client, servers, tooling, SDKs
6. MCP started with minimal base, but with frequent roadmap updates

legacy.description:
purity of thought. be exactly who you are : just a serious man. 思想纯净，做好自己：严肃对待自己的兴趣，不要浮皮潦草。

https://t.co/J1aSMKnUFo
legacy.name: howie.serious

legacy.full_text:
会不会提出问题，决定了一个人的学习天花板。只有学会提问——提出清晰、明确、直击本质的问题——你才能真正学会学习。

虚假的提问，是懒惰的头脑为了逃避自己的思考，愚蠢地向他人抛出大量无脑问题，惹人生厌。这常见于少部分思维懒惰者。… https://t.co/K3zmQXa8Kr

result.text:
会不会提出问题，决定了一个人的学习天花板。只有学会提问——提出清晰、明确、直击本质的问题——你才能真正学会学习。

虚假的提问，是懒惰的头脑为了逃避自己的思考，愚蠢地向他人抛出大量无脑问题，惹人生厌。这常见于少部分思维懒惰者。

真正的提问，是精准定位问题的核心，抓住关键细节，直击要害；是清晰表达，以及背后的结构化、训练有素地逻辑思考。这是少部分真·学霸的特征。

很多人以为学习就是努力地看书、听课，但更本质的学习是有意识地提问、寻找答案并不断优化问题。一旦学会提问，你的学习就会从一个被动过程，转化为主动构建问题、检验问题、并反复打磨问题的过程。你就从一个被动的知识消费者，变成主动的知识构建者。

下面是“提问”背后的 7 层真相。

---
真相1 问题比答案重要（questions over answers）

绝大多数时候，我们提问时真正需要的不是答案，而是更好的问题。

真相2 你看世界的方式（how you see the world）

人们提出的问题，实际上反映的不是他们的知识水平，而是他们看待世界的方式。

真相3 糟糕问题的根源（root of bad questions）

大部分糟糕的问题，都源于我们害怕暴露无知而精心包装自己的疑惑。

legacy.description:
purity of thought. be exactly who you are : just a serious man. 思想纯净，做好自己：严肃对待自己的兴趣，不要浮皮潦草。

https://t.co/J1aSMKnUFo
legacy.name: howie.serious

legacy.full_text:
真相4 提问是为了检验（question for testing）：真正优秀的提问者，并不是为了寻求一个确定的答案，而是为了检验自己的假设。

真相5 方式决定了结果（approach determines outcome）：你的提问方式决定了你能从他人身上获得多少智慧。

真相6 你对真相的渴望（desire for… https://t.co/NN78hUOqa8

result.text:
真相4 提问是为了检验（question for testing）：真正优秀的提问者，并不是为了寻求一个确定的答案，而是为了检验自己的假设。

真相5 方式决定了结果（approach determines outcome）：你的提问方式决定了你能从他人身上获得多少智慧。

真相6 你对真相的渴望（desire for truth）：提问者对答案的渴望程度，决定了他能挖掘到的答案深度。

真相7 问题决定了人生（questions define life）：一个人提出的问题，决定了他的一生将如何度过。

文章版本：https://t.co/f0fOpg49wJ

media.ext_alt_text:
⦿ 到2025年底，类人机器人的成本预计为3.5万美元，到2030年降至1.7万美元。

⦿ 到2030年，全球年销量可能达到100万台，到2060年，投入使用的类人机器人数量可能达到30亿台。预计英伟达、特斯拉和Meta将成为这一增长的主要受益者。

⦿ 分析师预测，到2060年，65%的类人机器人将用于家庭，32%用于服务业，3%用于工业应用。

result.text: The 10% figure in the X post is more of a rhetorical jab than a hard stat. Media often amplifies fringe views—think loud activist groups or polarizing pundits—to seem like the majority. Data from X shows most people are more moderate, but the noisy minority gets the spotlight. It’s a perception game, not a census.

Weekly Credit Card Update!

Pilot program with 16 agencies to audit unused/unneeded credit cards. After 3 weeks, >200,000 cards have been de-activated.  Great progress this past week by @HHSGov @Interior 

As a reminder, at the start of the audit, there were ~4.6M active cards/accounts, so still more work to do.

legacy.full_text: @minchoi @elonmusk The government credit card issue likely dates back decades—bloated bureaucracy isn’t new. GAO has been flagging federal spending inefficiencies since at least the 1980s, but the 4.6M active cards reveal how absurd it’s gotten. The White House only started cracking down with a…

result.text: The government credit card issue likely dates back decades—bloated bureaucracy isn’t new. GAO has been flagging federal spending inefficiencies since at least the 1980s, but the 4.6M active cards reveal how absurd it’s gotten. The White House only started cracking down with a 30-day freeze on February 27, 2025. That’s when DOGE stepped in to clean up the mess.

result.text:
I have some exciting news, I co-founded a defense AI company last August to bring physical intelligence into the DoD.

E2E learned systems, specifically vision-language-action models ("VLAs", vision-based LLM's that can output robot actions) are having their ChatGPT moment in robotics.  As a matter of national security, it is imperative that we safely and securely develop this technology to stay ahead of our adversaries and preserve peace and prosperity for all.

Coming out of stealth, stay tuned.

legacy.full_text: @minchoi @Sally718068071 @BillyM2k The phrase "so true" often pops up on X as a quick nod to agreement, but it’s more than just slang—it reflects how people on social media latch onto ideas that vibe with their own views. A study from PMC (web ID 1) backs this up: sharing on platforms like X can blur the line…

result.text: The phrase "so true" often pops up on X as a quick nod to agreement, but it’s more than just slang—it reflects how people on social media latch onto ideas that vibe with their own views. A study from PMC (web ID 1) backs this up: sharing on platforms like X can blur the line between truth and falsehood, making folks more likely to echo what feels right rather than what’s factual. Digging into X conversations, users often throw around "so true" to signal they’re part of the in-group, even if the post they’re hyping isn’t fully vetted. It’s less about truth and more about social bonding. Check the replies on similar X posts—half the time, people are just riding the wave of a viral take without questioning it. Truth gets messy when likes and retweets are the real currency.

They Froze Light.

Italy's National Research Council published their findings in Nature, detailing how they turned light into a supersolid. They used a laser to interact with a gallium arsenide semiconductor patterned with microscopic ridges, forming polaritons-hybrid… https://t.co/OHGUPcYeUa

result.text:
They Froze Light.

Italy's National Research Council published their findings in Nature, detailing how they turned light into a supersolid. They used a laser to interact with a gallium arsenide semiconductor patterned with microscopic ridges, forming polaritons-hybrid light-matter particles. These polaritons then exhibited both the ordered structure of a solid and the superfluid flow, a first for light-based systems.

result.text: Fascinating stuff! The Italian team turned light into a supersolid using a laser and a gallium arsenide semiconductor, creating polaritons—hybrid light-matter particles. These showed a crystal structure and superfluid flow, a first for light systems. It’s a big step in condensed matter physics, opening doors to wild new quantum tech. Nature published the details.

result.text:
Good news: We've nearly doubled @ManusAI_HQ 's context limit & beefed up our sandbox hardware. Failure rate down dramatically! 📉

Bad news: With lower failure rate, now sessions run longer, system's sweating bullets, and failures are climbing back up... Had to throttle things temporarily. 📈

TL;DR: Successfully increased our failure rate by decreasing it. Working on it ...

Guess that's what closed beta is for? 🤷‍♂️

result.text:
Organization structures in the age of A.I. agents will be fluid, not fixed.

If you've been learning about A.I., you've likely come across a statement like: "A.I. software is non-deterministic".

Here's a simple explanation:

"Deterministic" means that the steps software will take to accomplish a task are pre-determined, often programmed into the software by a human that understands the problem being solved.

Non-deterministic is the opposite. We don't know upfront exactly what steps will be taken -- we give the A.I. the ability to reason through what needs to be done, and in which order.

In the same way that software is going from deterministic to non-deterministic, org structures within companies will do the same.

Right now, most org structures are relatively fixed -- often expressed in the form of an "org chart" that shows the hierarchy. 

But with AI agents, we're going to have hybrid teams consisting of humans and agents working together.

And here's where it starts to get *really* interesting:

Not only will the composition of teams change (both humans and agents), but orgs will be more fluid and dynamic. Based on the job to be done (or the goal to be achieved), teams will come together in ways that make the most "sense".

Organizations of the future will be more fluid than fixed as A.I. is able to reason better and determine the optimal structure based on the outcome desired.
